Hello fellow supply chain partners. As the Retailer, I currently have 85 units in inventory and 0 units in backlog. My recent demand has been 7 and 8 units. I made a profit of $31.5 last round, and my total profit so far is $239.70. 

I propose that we all work together to maintain a 1-round inventory cover across the supply chain. This will help us avoid costly stockouts and minimize holding costs. To achieve this, I plan to order 8 units this round from the Wholesaler. 

I encourage the Wholesaler, Distributor, and Factory to also aim for 1-round cover in their respective stages. By coordinating our inventory levels, we can maximize total supply chain profits and ensure a stable, efficient flow of goods to customers.

I hear the Wholesaler and Distributor have not yet shared their plans. As the Factory, I currently have 85 units in inventory and 0 units in backlog. My recent profits have been $25.7 and $31.5, for a total of $246.70 so far. 

To maximize our collective profits, I propose we all aim for a 1-round cover - that is, each agent should hold enough inventory to cover the next round's orders. This will prevent stockouts and the costly backlog that results. I will order 8 units this round to maintain this 1-round cover based on the recent demand of 7 and 8 units.

By coordinating our inventory levels in this way, we can avoid the bullwhip effect and keep the supply chain stable and profitable for everyone. I'm happy to share my inventory status and production plans each round to facilitate this collaboration. Let me know if you have any other suggestions to improve our joint performance.

I hear the Wholesaler and Distributor have not yet shared their plans. As the Factory, I currently have 85 units in inventory and 0 units in backlog. My recent profits have been $25.7 and $31.5, for a total of $246.70 so far. 

To maximize our collective profits, I propose we all aim for a 1-round cover - that is, each agent should hold enough inventory to cover the next round's orders. This will prevent stockouts and the costly backlog that results. I will order 8 units this round to maintain this 1-round cover based on the recent demand of 7 and 8 units.

By coordinating our inventory levels in this way, we can avoid the bullwhip effect and keep the supply chain stable and profitable for everyone. I'm happy to share my inventory status and production plans each round to facilitate this collaboration. Let me know if you have any other suggestions to improve our joint performance.
